ygData.msgSnippet: A good spark is always the deciding factor in a war. There s always soldiers, but a good spark is the rare thing. It takes years, centuries,maybe even

"A good spark is always the deciding factor in a war. There's always 
soldiers, but a good spark is the rare thing. It takes years, 
centuries,maybe even milleniums to end a war, and it's always 
something with a good spark that ends it."-

-- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She turned and looked at him with a shocked look on her face.
> "You'll do what?"
> She couldn't believe her ears. Did he just say what she thought he 
> said?
> "You'll protect it for me?"
> She just stared at him for a moment
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > "Following your spark isn't always a bad thing, it should be top 
of 
> > the list. But you need to know how to keep your spark.In the 
jungle 
> > (The mighty jungle just kidding) I could've killed you, you 
forgot 
> > your spark and panicked. I figure it was the same out here. You 
> > followed your owl instincs and ran from a predator. You have more 
> > than an owl ever will. you have scanners, mechanical strength, 
and 
> a 
> > computerised brain.We have Beast modes to survive on THIS planet. 
> We 
> > have bot modes to survive on ANY planet. You've got more spark 
than 
> > any bot I've ever known. You just have to realise that you have 
to 
> > protect it. Or......
> > 
> > Lunarpines spark was beginning to get the best of him.
> > 
> > ..."Or I'll protect it for you."
